com.esotericsoftware.kryo
Class Kryo

java.lang.Object
  com.esotericsoftware.kryo.Kryo

public class Kryo
extends Object

Maps classes to serializers so object graphs can be serialized automatically.

Constructor Detail

Kryo

public Kryo()
Method Detail

register

public void register(Class type,
                     Serializer serializer)
Registers a class to be serialized. The exact same classes and serializers must be registered in exactly the same order when the class is deserialized.

By default primitive types, primitive wrappers, and java.lang.String are registered. To transfer ANY other classes over the network, those classes must be registered. Note that even JDK classes like ArrayList, HashMap, etc must be registered. Also, array classes such as "int[].class" or "short[][].class" must be registered.

The Serializer specified will be used to serialize and deserialize objects of the specified type. Note that a serializer can be wrapped with a Compressor.

If the class is already registered, the serializer will be changed.

See Also:
register(Class), Serializer, Compressor

register

public Serializer register(Class type)
Registers the class, automatically determining the serializer to use. A serializer will be chosen according to this table:

Type Serializer
array (any number of dimensions) ArraySerializer
Enum EnumSerializer
Collection CollectionSerializer
Map MapSerializer
CustomSerialization CustomSerializer
any other class FieldSerializer

Note that some serializers allow additional information to be specified to make serialization more efficient in some cases (eg, FieldSerializer.getField(Class, String)).

Returns:
The serializer registered for the class.
See Also:
register(Class, Serializer)

public Serializer getSerializer(Class type)

writeClass

public Kryo.RegisteredClass writeClass(ByteBuffer buffer,
                                       Class type)
Writes the ID of the specified class to the buffer.

Parameters:
type - Can be null (writes a special class ID for a null object).
Returns:
The registered information for the class that was written, or null of the specified class was null.

readClass

public Kryo.RegisteredClass readClass(ByteBuffer buffer)
Reads the class ID from the buffer.

Returns:
The registered information for the class that was read, or null if the data read from the buffer represented a null object.

writeClassAndObject

public void writeClassAndObject(ByteBuffer buffer,
                                Object object)
Writes the object's class ID to the buffer, then uses the serializer registered for that class to write the object to the buffer.

Parameters:
object - Can be null (writes a special class ID for a null object instead).

writeObject

public void writeObject(ByteBuffer buffer,
                        Object object)
Uses the serializer registered for the object's class to write the object to the buffer.

Parameters:
object - Can be null (writes a special class ID for a null object instead).

writeObjectData

public void writeObjectData(ByteBuffer buffer,
                            Object object)
Uses the serializer registered for the object's class to write the object to the buffer.

Parameters:
object - Cannot be null.

readClassAndObject

public Object readClassAndObject(ByteBuffer buffer)
Reads a class ID from the buffer and uses the serializer registered for that class to read an object from the buffer.

Returns:
The deserialized object, or null if the object read from the buffer was null.

readObject

public <T> T readObject(ByteBuffer buffer,
                        Class<T> type)
Uses the serializer registered for the specified class to read an object from the buffer.

Returns:
The deserialized object, or null if the object read from the buffer was null.

readObjectData

public <T> T readObjectData(ByteBuffer buffer,
                            Class<T> type)
Uses the serializer registered for the specified class to read an object from the buffer.

Returns:
The deserialized object, never null.

addListener

public void addListener(KryoListener listener)

removeListener

public void removeListener(KryoListener listener)

removeRemoteEntity

public void removeRemoteEntity(int remoteEntityID)
Notifies all listeners that the remote entity with the specified ID will no longer be available.

See Also:
Context.getRemoteEntityID(), addListener(KryoListener)

getContext

public static Context getContext()
Returns the thread local context for serialization and deserialization.
